intro: Beilschmiedia ningmingensis, commonly known as the Ningming beilschmiedia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lauraceae. It is native to China, specifically the Yunnan Province, where it grows in humid, lowland forests. The plant is characterized by its evergreen leaves, which are typically elliptical and glossy. It produces small, fragrant flowers that are usually white or pale yellow, followed by orange or red berries. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
